text: thankyou <@U7SL518D6>

... And if you're not getting the actionable information you need from HubSpot, consider reaching out to a independent HubSpot consultant, like me!
BAM
Those are standard for pictures
if only we had the budget Bob :wink:

watching it now - there's some really good content in this! Anybody interested in an annotated listing of timestamps so you can get at the good stuff? For example: clicking <https://youtu.be/VpArzDy5ny4?t=4746> will take you to an Excellent talk about using Postman to get data from a HubSpot instance (no app needed).
oh that is smart!
<@U26BLKGE4> putting annotated links in the description may honestly be good enough
was planning on doing this tonight anyway for our internal team, I'll update the description as well, saves a bunch of time vs recutting lol
Timestamps are updated now
Hello everyone, so I just wonder about 1 question

On the preview window with url "xxxxxxx?hs_preview=ZtSRzssl-12900535037",  everything seems fine, but when I delete the "?hs_preview=ZtSRzssl-12900535037" and refresh the window, it turns out to be different

So I wonder after remove the "hs_preview" part in the url, what happended :disappointed:  is the http request changed? or it just goes back to the last published version, not the preview version? Thank you very much
it is a different request.  one is a preview of your changes, the other is not.
Awesome! Thanks Mark (P.S. Applied after watching your session to SmartBug).
Thank you Dennis! That helps!
Is anyone aware of how to add a FOLLOW-UP Email selector to a custom module that rides along with a form??  This field type doesn’t seem to be available…  Any ideas on what I might be missing?

<@U7KKA4QQM> Curious to know the benefits of building a HubSpot website if you don't use HubSpot forms.  Or maybe you're suggesting only using a HIPAA form when it's necessary and use HS forms for everything else.

<@UDV9GD8BB> exactly right, if you have to collect patient information you need to have to store the data in a more secure manner. I believe storing personal information in HubSpot is still a violation of their terms.
Agreed!  We use a HIPAA hosted form for appointment requests and other data that may have PHI.  Always curious how others handle this tricky issue.  Thanks!  Have a good night
